com.googlecode.aluminumproject.utilities

Class GenericsUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.utilities.GenericsUtilities

  • public class GenericsUtilities
extends Object
    Provides utility methods related to generics.

    • Method Detail

      • getTypeArgument

        public static Class<?> getTypeArgument(Class<?> parameterisedType,
                       Class<?> genericType,
                       int index)
                                throws AluminumException
        Finds a positioned argument to a generic type (class or interface) for a certain class. In other words: it finds the class with which a generic interface has been implemented or the class that was used to subclass a generic class. Some example calls and their return values:

        getTypeArgument(String.class, Comparable.class, 0); // String.class: String implements Comparable<String>
        getTypeArgument(ElementType.class, Enum.class, 0); // ElementType.class: ElementType extends Enum<ElementType>
        getTypeArgument(RuleBasedCollator.class, Comparator.class, 0); // Object.class: Collator implements Comparator<Object>

        Parameters:
        parameterisedType - the type of which the type argument should be determined
        genericType - the class extended by or the interface implemented by parameterisedType
        index - the (zero-based) index that indicates which type argument should be retrieved
        Returns:
        the type argument at position index used by parameterisedType to extend or implement genericType
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the type argument can't be worked out

      • getName

        public static String getName(Type type,
             String... defaultPackages)
        Returns the name of a type.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to return the name of
        defaultPackages - the packages that do not need to be included in the name
        Returns:
        the name of the given type

      • getType

        public static Type getType(String name,
           String... defaultPackages)
                    throws AluminumException
        Finds or creates a type, based on its name. The following types are supported:
        • Primitive types (int, boolean);
        • Classes (java.lang.Object);
        • Generic array types (java.util.List<java.lang.String>[]);
        • Parameterised types (java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer>);
        • Wildcard types (?, ? super java.lang.Long, ? extends java.lang.Number, ? extends java.lang.Number & java.io.Serializable).
        Class names are expected to be fully qualified, unless their packages are contained in the defaultPackages parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the type to find or create
        defaultPackages - the packages for which class names don't have to be qualified
        Returns:
        the type with the given name
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the type can't be found or created
